articleBody.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"In version 24.2, ReportPortal offers 2x faster reporting under a 100% load: we’ve implemented a new asynchronous reporting approach. One of the key changes is the transition from a Direct exchange to a Consistent-hashing exchange. Using this exchange mechanism allows us to distribute messages more evenly and significantly boosts consumption efficiency from RabbitMQ by leveraging consistent hashing. Additionally, the retry mechanism was reworked to handle only messages related to the reporting order. Not related errors will be moved to parking lot queue without retries.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"In the previous implementation, the number of Retry queues had to match the number of reporting queues. Now, we have simplified this by using a single Retry queue for all API Service replicas.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The number of Reporting queues remains the same as before, and you can still define the specific number of reporting queues during deployment. However, the number of Retry queues is simplified using a single Retry queue for all API Service replicas instead of matching the number to reporting queues.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Regarding the Dead letter queue, previously, messages lacked post-processing, causing them to stack indefinitely and consume a lot of space in RabbitMQ, requiring manual cleanup. In the new asynchronous reporting, we have implemented post-processing, where messages are automatically cleaned up after a defined time-to-live (TTL) timeout. This TTL can be flexibly configured during deployment and can vary for different workloads.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"As for Autoscaling, the old asynchronous reporting mode did not support it because we had to hardcode values for the total number of queues in our deployment. Now, we have introduced Autoscaling.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"We are glad to introduce the API service Autoscaling with the new asynchronous reporting implementation. Please refer to ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/installation-steps-advanced/ScalingReportPortalServices"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"this documentation","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" and ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/developers-guides/AsynchronousReporting"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"this guide","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" to read more technical details. The old asynchronous reporting did not support it as we had to declare the values for the total number of queues and per API queues in our deployment.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Let’s review the RabbitMQ metrics: ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Consuming speed:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" we offer 2x faster reporting using asynchronous endpoints under a 100% load of ReportPortal compared to the previous implementation. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Total messages processed:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" performance tests show that we are processing almost 18% more messages within the same time-range compared to the old asynchronous mode. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Total consuming time:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" with the new consistent-hashing exchanges, we need 30% less time to process over 73% more messages.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"1NKOgZYpqUhwhSSaepKXLY","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"32fWOSTrHngp8ygyIf5lIS","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Let's explore how it performs in RabbitMQ:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"3sKva3hAwN8h9ccaXAY0Lx","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The main achievement is that we now consume up to 2,000 messages per second under 100% load between 2 to 4 PM, which represents a 100% increase in speed.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Going forward, the streamlined queue structure, improved post-processing with configurable time-to-live settings, and the introduction of autoscaling collectively enhance ReportPortal's ability to handle higher loads more effectively.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

title.title: Boost asynchronous test reporting speed by 2x

leadParagraph.leadParagraph: In version 24.2, ReportPortal offers 2x faster reporting under a 100% load: we’ve implemented a new asynchronous reporting approach. One of the key changes is the transition from a Direct exchange to a Consistent-hashing exchange.

articleBody.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Effective communication and real-time collaboration are crucial for team success, particularly in automated testing, where timely updates keep everyone informed. That's why ReportPortal is excited to introduce a powerful feature: Slack notifications for launch finishes.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"What is Slack?","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Slack is a communication and collaboration tool which enhances productivity by streamlining team interactions. It enables users to create channels dedicated to specific teams, projects, or topics, ensuring that conversations stay targeted and relevant. Within these channels, team members can discuss projects, share files, and stay updated on important tasks.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"In addition to messaging, Slack integrates with many other tools and services, making it easier for teams to work efficiently by bringing everything they need into one place. Integrating ReportPortal with Slack brings test automation results directly to your team, enabling quick visibility and faster action.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Importance of real-time test result sharing","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"In fast-moving industries like software development, immediate access to test results allows teams to fix bugs promptly and prevent bigger issues down the line.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Real-time sharing of test results encourages proactive problem-solving. Instead of waiting for a daily report or a scheduled meeting, developers and testers can respond to issues as they happen, leading to faster resolutions and a more agile development process.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Integrating ReportPortal with Slack centralizes notifications, ensuring critical updates reach the entire team. This integration is especially valuable in remote or distributed teams, where real-time communication and collaboration are vital to overcoming geographical barriers and maintaining an organized workflow.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Integration of ReportPortal and Slack","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Enabling Slack notifications in ReportPortal is a simple process. Follow these steps to start receiving real-time updates in your Slack channel:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"1. Create a Slack workspace and channel","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Log in to your Slack account. Create Slack workspace and a channel in the workspace.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"2. Create a Slack App","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Go to the Slack API page, select ‘Create an App’, and choose the workspace where you want the notifications to be sent.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"3. Generate a Webhook URL","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Once your app is created, navigate to ‘Incoming Webhooks’ under the Features section. Activate incoming webhooks and add a new webhook to your desired channel. This URL will be used to send notifications from ReportPortal.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"4. Configure ReportPortal","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"In ReportPortal, upload Slack plugin and go to the settings of your project. Find the ‘Notifications’ section and create notification rule. Paste the webhook URL you generated in the previous step.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"5. Customize your notifications","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Choose in which case you want to receive notifications after the launch is finished: Always, 10% of items have issues, 20% of items have issues, 50% of items have issues, Launch has issues, Launch has ‘To Investigate’ items.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"1Lj24ouDGlcvhwYGYXl2bb","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"6. Test and activate","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"After saving your settings, initiate a test run to ensure the notifications are being sent as expected. If everything works smoothly, your team will now receive real-time updates directly in Slack!","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/plugins/Slack"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Detailed guide","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" you can find in Documentation.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Advantages of reporting test results via Slack","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Reporting test results via Slack offers numerous advantages:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"1. Automation of reporting","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"With ReportPortal integration, test results will be automatically posted to specific Slack channels as soon as launch is finished.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"This saves time and reduces human error in the reporting process.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"2. Immediate notifications","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Slack’s notification system ensures that the right people are alerted immediately when test results are available.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"This enables quicker responses to any issues that arise from the test results.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"3. Facilitated collaboration","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Slack allows team members to discuss and address issues immediately in the same thread where the test results are posted.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"This facilitates quicker problem resolution, enhancing team efficiency.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"4. Searchable history","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Slack’s searchable history feature allows you to quickly find and review previous test results.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Therefore, Slack is a powerful tool that transforms team collaboration. Sharing test results quickly and in the right place is key to keeping your team informed and on track. In turn, incorporating Slack notifications for launch finish in ReportPortal helps improve test automation reporting and overall development efficiency.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

title.title: Report test results in real time to Slack

leadParagraph.leadParagraph: Effective communication and real-time collaboration are crucial for team success, particularly in automated testing, where timely updates keep everyone informed. That's why ReportPortal is excited to introduce a powerful feature: Slack notifications for launch finishes.

articleBody.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"ReportPortal has several features to support effective test failure analysis. This article provides actionable strategies for setting up Pattern Analysis rules to maximize the potential of this powerful analytical method and drive better business outcomes.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"heading-2","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"What is Pattern Analysis?","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/analysis/PatternAnalysis"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Pattern Analysis","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" is a feature used in software testing to help identify and analyze recurring patterns in error logs. It is commonly used in automation testing reporting tools, such as ReportPortal, to streamline the process of debugging and resolving test failures.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The following sections will guide you through the best practices and practical examples that demonstrate how Pattern Analysis can be implemented in various contexts.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"1. Create rules for standard errors","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"If you don’t know where to start with Pattern Analysis, create rules for common errors:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"400 Bad Request","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" – this could indicate an issue with the tests. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"401 Unauthorized","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" – something may not be properly specified in the tests. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"403 Forbidden","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" – this could be a product issue, or certain details like passwords might not be provided in the tests. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"500 Internal Server Error","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" – this is likely not an issue with the automated tests; it suggests that your servers or some external services are unavailable. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Create rules to search for these errors, run Pattern Analysis on a launch, and it will be easier to sort test failures by defect types.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"17hAuBj1GVP14J6Y8RwBlW","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"For example, consider the following: error codes in the 400-409 range are often caused by a ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Product Bug","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" or an ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Automation Bug","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":". A 500 Internal Server Error most often corresponds to a ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Product Bug","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" or a ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"System Issue","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":". However, it's essential to review the error log to assign the correct defect type.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"2. Study the documentation for your project","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ask developers about errors that can be observed in backend responses, which ones are critical, and which are less serious. Based on this information, create rules for Pattern Analysis to address these errors.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"3. Create rules using regular expressions","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"In ReportPortal, you can create a Pattern Analysis rule with the help of regular expressions. This allows you to create fewer rules. For instance, if you know that various numbers appear in the tests, you could create several string rules for each number, or you could create a single RegEx rule to cover all numbers. Pattern analysis example:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"65dRBeoIMW79qlvQqKmlCm","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"5B30MGJb0dpUuPueZmb0RU","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Alternatively, if you know that some error logs end with the phrase \"not found,\" you can create a rule to identify such tests.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"4uGclRnvfdvwbwRmojJBxC","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"7uCffmrqS27MIaVkH5zgFo","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"4. Create Most popular pattern table and disable unnecessary rules","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"If you have many rules, you can create ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://reportportal.io/docs/dashboards-and-widgets/MostPopularPatternTableTop20"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"“Most popular pattern table” widget","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" to view the Top-20 patterns that frequently appear in test automation results. The widget sorts patterns by how often they occur, allowing teams to easily spot common issues and plan how to fix them effectively.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"WAXALhknjuN4pNS15CSP4","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"You can set some of Pattern Analysis rules as inactive if they are irrelevant for specific launches. You can also enable or disable Auto Pattern Analysis.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"H6wBib3ggHxUWXgbdeeo9","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Don’t worry if you forget to enable Auto Pattern Analysis – you can always run Pattern Analysis manually.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"5VqHwEmyjKvBpafc3JQ7ii","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"By setting up and customizing rules that match specific error patterns, teams can automate the identification and categorization of failures, leading to faster problem resolution and better overall software quality.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

title.title: Improving test failure analysis with pattern rules

leadParagraph.leadParagraph: ReportPortal has several features to support effective test failure analysis. This article provides actionable strategies for setting up Pattern Analysis rules to maximize the potential of this powerful analytical method and drive better business outcomes.
